did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Refers to paintings in a building in Nebraska(State Capitol ?), and his feelings about the Goodhue plan; wonders if anyone has suggested displaying General Ashley's expedition; mentions his work, The Splendid Wayfarer, as it tells the whole story of the Ashley expedition.]

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Thanks him for his kindness in managing the "affair of the 18th"; promises to reward his kindness through loyalty and good work.]

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Thanks him for a fine editorial on his work; gives him a selection of his lyrics which he suggests be printed in the newspaper; mentions his progress with The Song of the Indian Wars, which he considers his greatest achievement.]

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Thanks him for another "bully" editorial; expresses gratitude for seeing his poems published in the newspaper as he wants Nebraskans, of all people, to know him; gives progress report on The Song of the Indian Wars; claims that he is not working for personal advantage; regards all who help as collaborators.] (includes autograph notations)

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Asks him for copies of his, as well as Professor Reed's, Dean Sherman's , and Mr. Brown's speeches, given at the Temple on June 18, to be published in Chicago. ]

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Apologizes for long delay in sending promised letter to Richard G. Moulton, England; mentions daughter's operation and hard physical labor to which he is not accustomed; includes progress report on The Song of the Indian Wars. ] (Includes autograph notations)

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Reports on the "good and profitable time" he had in Washingtontalking with old Indian fighters of the plains; says he has had good audiences; mentions speaking engagement with the young ladies of Hood Collegein Frederick; says he "compromised on lyrics" but was kept going a long time; regards the students as "very discerning"; speculates on the possibility of occupying the Chair of Poetry at the University of Nebraska. ]

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Reports on a 6 week speaking tour through Texasand the progress of his book; thanks him for copy of By Land and Sea. ]

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Requests that a copy of the Sunday Journalbe sent to his wife as it contains Jones' remarks on Neigardt's trip to Lincoln, Nebraska; says he is pleased with receptions of his speaking tour, but he is too tired to take on more assignments.]

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Editor, The Literary Review[ Will Orton Tewson]

scopecontent.p: [Answers the question, "What is the most beautiful line of poetry in the English language?" by directing the editor's attention to his forthcoming book More Truth than Poetry. ]

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Gives him the dates of several of his speaking engagements.]

did.unittitle: John Gneisenau Neigardtto Will Owen Jones

scopecontent.p: [Writes about a meeting with Professor A. A. Reedpertaining to getting the Professorship at the University of Nebraska; says that permanent residence in Lincolnappeals to him.]
